required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Exploratory Study of SPD489 in Adults With Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) as Augmentation Therapy to an Antidepressant
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Placebo Controlled Exploratory Efficacy and Safety Study of SPD489 in Adults 18-55 Years With Major Depressive Disorder (MDD) as Augmentation Therapy to an Antidepressant

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the efficacy of SPD489 when used as augmentation to an antidepressant in the treatment of major depressive disorder (MDD) as measured by mean change in total Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) scores.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at Week 6 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
primary_outcome.description: MADRS is a validated, 10-item rating scale with each item being scored on a scale from 0-6 with a total score ranging from 0-60. Lower scores indicate a decreased severity of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in the Hamilton Depression Scale (HAM-D) Total Score at Week 6 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: The HAM-D is a validated rating scale which consists of 17 items. Nine of the items are scored on a scale of 0-4 and 8 items are scored on a scale of 0-2 for a total scoring range of 0-52. A score of 0-7 is generally accepted to be within the normal range (or in clinical remission), while a score of 20 or higher indicates increased severity of depression. In general, the lower the total score the less severe the depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in the Sheehan Disability Scale (SDS) Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Designed to evaluate the extent to which illness symptoms impact a subject's life in 3 areas: work/school, social, and family/home. Each area is scored on a scale from 0 (no impairment) to 10 (highly impaired) with a total score ranging from 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). Lower scores translate into less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Non-Remitters With Improvement on Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) at Week 6 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment in Non-Remitters of Clinical Global Impression-Severity of Illness (CGI-S) at Augmentation Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment in Non-Remitters of Clinical Global Impression-Severity of Illness (CGI-S) at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in the Behavior Rating Inventory of Executive Function - Adult Version (BRIEF-A) Scale Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 75-item questionnaire composed of three scales (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). There is no range for a total score. Raw scale scores are used to develop interpretive reports. Lower scores reflect better functioning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in the Multidimensional Assessment of Fatigue (MAF) Scale Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: MAF contains 16 items scored on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 10 (a great deal). Answers are converted to a Global Fatigue Index with total scores ranging from 1 (no fatigue) to 50 (severe fatigue). Lower scores indicate less fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in the Quick Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology - Self-Report (QIDS-SR) Scale Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: QIDS-SR is a validated, self-reported rating scale that contains 16 items scored on a scale from 0-3 with total scores ranging from 0 (no depression) to 27 (very severe depression). Lower scores indicate less depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in MADRS Total Score at Week 6 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: MADRS is a validated, 10-item rating scale with each item being scored on a scale from 0-6 with a total score ranging from 0-60. Lower scores indicate a decreased severity of depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the HAM-D Total Score at Week 6 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: The HAM-D is a validated rating scale which consists of 17 items. Nine of the items are scored on a scale of 0-4 and 8 items are scored on a scale of 0-2 for a total scoring range of 0-52. A score of 0-7 is generally accepted to be within the normal range (or in clinical remission), while a score of 20 or higher indicates increased severity of depression. In general, the lower the total score the less severe the depression.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the SDS Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: Designed to evaluate the extent to which illness symptoms impact a subject's life in 3 areas: work/school, social, and family/home. Each area is scored on a scale from 0 (no impairment) to 10 (highly impaired) with a total score ranging from 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). Lower scores translate into less impairment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Remitters With Improvement on CGI-I at Week 6 - LOCF
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment in Remitters of CGI-S at Augmentation Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment in Remitters of CGI-S at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the BRIEF-A Scale Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 86-item questionnaire composed of three scales (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Lower scores reflect better functioning.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the MAF Scale Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: MAF contains 16 items scored on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 10 (a great deal). Answers are converted to a Global Fatigue Index with total scores ranging from 1 (no fatigue) to 50 (severe fatigue). Lower scores indicate less fatigue.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the QIDS-SR Scale Total Score at Week 6
secondary_outcome.description: QIDS-SR is a validated, self-reported rating scale that contains 16 items scored on a scale from 0-3 with total scores ranging from 0 (no depression) to 27 (very severe depression). Lower scores indicate less depression.

intervention.description: Escitalopram oxalate (antidepressant) 20 mg/day oral + 20, 30, or 50 mg SPD489 oral once daily for 6 weeks
Escitalopram oxalate (antidepressant) 20 mg/day oral + placebo oral once daily for 6 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults aged 18-55 with a primary diagnosis of nonpsychotic MDD
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of non-response to multiple antidepressants

results_reference.citation: Trivedi MH, Cutler AJ, Richards C, Lasser R, Geibel BB, Gao J, Sambunaris A, Patkar AA. A randomized controlled trial of the efficacy and safety of lisdexamfetamine dimesylate as augmentation therapy in adults with residual symptoms of major depressive disorder after treatment with escitalopram. J Clin Psychiatry. 2013 Aug;74(8):802-9. doi: 10.4088/JCP.13m08360.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 246 subjects entered the antidepressant lead-in phase receiving escitalopram oxalate (antidepressant) 20 mg/day for 8 weeks. After 8 weeks, subjects with residual depressive symptoms (n = 177) were randomly assigned (stratified by remission, either remitters or non-remitters) to receive augmentation therapy (either SPD489 or placebo).

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms (symptoms of depression that remain after initial antidepressant treatment) after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (antidepressant @ 20 mg/day + SPD489 @ either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks. This includes both non-remitters (Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale [MADRS] total score greater than 10 at augmentation baseline) and remitters (MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline).

group.title: Antidepressant + Placebo .
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (antidepressant @ 20 mg/day + placebo) for 6 weeks. This includes both non-remitters and remitters.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms (symptoms of depression that remain after initial antidepressant treatment) after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (antidepressant @ 20 mg/day + SPD489 @ either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks. This includes both non-remitters (Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale [MADRS] total score greater than 10 at augmentation baseline) and remitters (MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline).

group.title: Antidepressant + Placebo .
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (antidepressant @ 20 mg/day + placebo) for 6 weeks. This includes both non-remitters and remitters.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Age
measure.description: 177 subjects were randomized. However, 4 withdrew before receiving any randomized augmentation treatment. Therefore, 173 subjects were included in the Randomized Safety Analysis Set defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and at least 1 follow-up safety assessment.

measure.title: Age, Customized
measure.description: 177 subjects were randomized. However, 4 withdrew before receiving any randomized augmentation treatment. Therefore, 173 subjects were included in the Randomized Safety Analysis Set defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and at least 1 follow-up safety assessment.

measure.title: Gender
measure.description: 177 subjects were randomized. However, 4 withdrew before receiving any randomized augmentation treatment. Therefore, 173 subjects were included in the Randomized Safety Analysis Set defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and at least 1 follow-up safety assessment.

measure.title: Region of Enrollment
measure.description: 177 subjects were randomized. However, 4 withdrew before receiving any randomized augmentation treatment. Therefore, 173 subjects were included in the Randomized Safety Analysis Set defined as all subjects who took at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and at least 1 follow-up safety assessment.

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at Week 6 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
outcome.description: MADRS is a validated, 10-item rating scale with each item being scored on a scale from 0-6 with a total score ranging from 0-60. Lower scores indicate a decreased severity of depression.
outcome.population: Primary Efficacy Analysis Set defined as all non-remitters (MADRS total score greater than 10 at augmentation baseline) who take at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and have at least 1 primary efficacy measurement after randomization.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Non-remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by Non-remitters and remitters. Non-remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of greater than 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + an optimal dose of SPD489 (either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks.

group.title: Antidepressant + Placebo (Non-remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (placebo). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by Non-remitters and remitters. Non-remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of greater than 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + placebo for 6 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale (MADRS) Total Score at Week 6 - Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF)
measure.description: MADRS is a validated, 10-item rating scale with each item being scored on a scale from 0-6 with a total score ranging from 0-60. Lower scores indicate a decreased severity of depression.
measure.population: Primary Efficacy Analysis Set defined as all non-remitters (MADRS total score greater than 10 at augmentation baseline) who take at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and have at least 1 primary efficacy measurement after randomization.

analysis.p_value_desc: The test was performed a priori at the significance level of 0.10

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Non-Remitters in the Hamilton Depression Scale (HAM-D) Total Score at Week 6 - LOCF
outcome.description: The HAM-D is a validated rating scale which consists of 17 items. Nine of the items are scored on a scale of 0-4 and 8 items are scored on a scale of 0-2 for a total scoring range of 0-52. A score of 0–7 is generally accepted to be within the normal range (or in clinical remission), while a score of 20 or higher indicates increased severity of depression. In general, the lower the total score the less severe the depression.

measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS) defined as all subjects who take at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and have at least 1 primary efficacy measurement after randomization.

analysis.p_value_desc: The test was performed a priori at the significance level of 0.10

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the HAM-D Total Score at Week 6 - LOCF
outcome.description: The HAM-D is a validated rating scale which consists of 17 items. Nine of the items are scored on a scale of 0-4 and 8 items are scored on a scale of 0-2 for a total scoring range of 0-52. A score of 0–7 is generally accepted to be within the normal range (or in clinical remission), while a score of 20 or higher indicates increased severity of depression. In general, the lower the total score the less severe the depression.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + an optimal dose of SPD489 (either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks.

group.title: Antidepressant + Placebo (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (placebo). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + placebo for 6 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the HAM-D Total Score at Week 6 - LOCF
measure.description: The HAM-D is a validated rating scale which consists of 17 items. Nine of the items are scored on a scale of 0-4 and 8 items are scored on a scale of 0-2 for a total scoring range of 0-52. A score of 0–7 is generally accepted to be within the normal range (or in clinical remission), while a score of 20 or higher indicates increased severity of depression. In general, the lower the total score the less severe the depression.

analysis.p_value_desc: The test was performed a priori at the significance level of 0.10

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the SDS Total Score at Week 6
outcome.description: Designed to evaluate the extent to which illness symptoms impact a subject's life in 3 areas: work/school, social, and family/home. Each area is scored on a scale from 0 (no impairment) to 10 (highly impaired) with a total score ranging from 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). Lower scores translate into less impairment.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + an optimal dose of SPD489 (either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks.

Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + placebo for 6 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the SDS Total Score at Week 6
measure.description: Designed to evaluate the extent to which illness symptoms impact a subject's life in 3 areas: work/school, social, and family/home. Each area is scored on a scale from 0 (no impairment) to 10 (highly impaired) with a total score ranging from 0 (unimpaired) to 30 (highly impaired). Lower scores translate into less impairment.

analysis.p_value_desc: The test was performed a priori at the significance level of 0.10

outcome.title: Percentage of Remitters With Improvement on CGI-I at Week 6 - LOCF
outcome.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + an optimal dose of SPD489 (either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks.

Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + placebo for 6 weeks.

measure.title: Percentage of Remitters With Improvement on CGI-I at Week 6 - LOCF
measure.description: Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) consists of a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse). Improvement is defined as a score of 1 (very much improved) or 2 (much improved) on the scale.

outcome.title: Assessment in Remitters of CGI-S at Augmentation Baseline
outcome.description: CGI-S assesses the severity of the subject's condition on a 7-point scale ranging from 1 (normal, not at all ill) to 7 (among the most extremely ill)

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the BRIEF-A Scale Total Score at Week 6
outcome.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 86-item questionnaire composed of three scales (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Lower scores reflect better functioning.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + an optimal dose of SPD489 (either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks.

measure.description: BRIEF-A is a validated 86-item questionnaire composed of three scales (Global Executive Composite, Behavioral Recognition Index, and Metacognition Index). Items are rated 1 (never), 2 (sometimes), and 3 (often). Lower scores reflect better functioning.

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the MAF Scale Total Score at Week 6
outcome.description: MAF contains 16 items scored on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 10 (a great deal). Answers are converted to a Global Fatigue Index with total scores ranging from 1 (no fatigue) to 50 (severe fatigue). Lower scores indicate less fatigue.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + an optimal dose of SPD489 (either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks.

Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Subjects received antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) + placebo for 6 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the MAF Scale Total Score at Week 6
measure.description: MAF contains 16 items scored on a scale from 1 (not at all) to 10 (a great deal). Answers are converted to a Global Fatigue Index with total scores ranging from 1 (no fatigue) to 50 (severe fatigue). Lower scores indicate less fatigue.

analysis.p_value_desc: The test was performed a priori at the significance level of 0.10

outcome.title: Change From Augmentation Baseline for Remitters in the QIDS-SR Scale Total Score at Week 6
outcome.description: QIDS-SR is a validated, self-reported rating scale that contains 16 items scored on a scale from 0-3 with total scores ranging from 0 (no depression) to 27 (very severe depression). Lower scores indicate less depression.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489 (Remitters)
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (SPD489). At augmentation baseline, randomization was stratified by non-remitters and remitters. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. Remitters were defined as subjects who had an MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline. analysis.p_value_desc: The test was performed a priori at the significance level of 0.10

reported_events.desc: Randomized Safety Analysis Set (RSAS) defined as all subjects who take at least 1 dose of randomized augmentation treatment and at least 1 follow-up safety assessment.

group.title: Antidepressant + SPD489
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms (symptoms of depression that remain after initial antidepressant treatment) after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant (escitalopram @ 20 mg/day) were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (antidepressant @ 20 mg/day + SPD489 @ either 20, 30, or 50 mg/day) for 6 weeks. This includes both non-remitters (Montgomery-Ǻsberg Depression Rating Scale [MADRS] total score greater than 10 at augmentation baseline) and remitters (MADRS total score of less than or equal to 10 at augmentation baseline).

group.title: Antidepressant + Placebo .
group.description: Subjects with residual depressive symptoms after the 8-week lead-in period with antidepressant were randomly assigned to receive augmentation therapy (antidepressant @ 20 mg/day + placebo) for 6 weeks. This includes both non-remitters and remitters.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: If a multicenter publication is not submitted within twelve (12) months after conclusion, abandonment or termination of the Study at all sites, or after Sponsor confirms there shall be no multicenter Study publication, the Institution and/or such Principal Investigator may publish the results from the Institution site individually.
